Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

picture.description: Check if this attachment is a picture (analyse the file's extension).

3d_model.description: Check if this attachment is a 3D model and therefore can be directly shown to user.

external.description: Checks if this attachment has a path to an external file

internal.description: Checks if this attachment has a path to an internal file.

private.description: Check if this attachment is saved in a secure place.

builtIn.description:
Checks if the attachment file is using a builtin file. (see BUILTIN_PLACEHOLDERS const for possible placeholders)
If a file is built in, the path is shown to user in url field (no sensitive infos are provided).

internal_path.description: The URL to the internally saved copy of the file, if one exists

thumbnail_url.description: The URL to a thumbnail version of this file. This only exists for internal picture attachments.

upload.description:
The options used for uploading a file to this attachment or modify it.
This value is not persisted in the database, but is just used to pass options to the upload manager.
If it is null, no upload process is started.

element.description: ORM mapping is done in subclasses (like PartAttachment).

url.description:
Set the path of the attachment here. 
    Provide either an external URL, a path to a builtin file (like %FOOTPRINTS%/Active/ICs/IC_DFS.png) or an empty 
    string if the attachment has an internal file associated and you'd like to reset the external source.
    If you set a new (nonempty) file path any associated internal file will be removed!

scale.description: The scale (number of digits after the decimal point) of this decimal number.

positive.description: Checks if this number is strictly positive.

bitLength.description: Returns the number of bits in the minimal two's-complement representation of this BigInteger, excluding a sign bit.

lowestSetBit.description: Returns the index of the rightmost (lowest-order) one bit in this BigInteger.

even.description: Returns whether this number is even.

odd.description: Returns whether this number is odd.

Category-Read.description: This entity describes a category, a part can belong to, which is used to group parts by their function.

parent.description: Get the parent of this element.

comment.description: Get the comment of the element as markdown encoded string.

partname_hint.description: The hint which is shown as hint under the partname field, when a part is created in this category.

partname_regex.description: The regular expression which is used to validate the partname of a part in this category.

disable_footprints.description: Set to true, if the footprints should be disabled for parts this category (not implemented yet).

disable_manufacturers.description: Set to true, if the manufacturers should be disabled for parts this category (not implemented yet).

disable_autodatasheets.description: Set to true, if the autodatasheets should be disabled for parts this category (not implemented yet).

disable_properties.description: Set to true, if the properties should be disabled for parts this category (not implemented yet).

default_description.description: The default description for parts in this category.

default_comment.description: The default comment for parts in this category.

addedDate.description: Returns the date/time when the element was created.

lastModified.description: Returns the last time when the element was modified.

id.description:
The Identification number for this part. This value is unique for the element in this table.
Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

MeasurementUnit-Read.description:
This unit represents the unit in which the amount of parts in stock are measured.
This could be something like N, grams, meters, etc...

unit.description:
The unit symbol that should be used for the Unit. This could be something like "", g (for grams)
or m (for meters).

comment.description: Get the comment of the element as markdown encoded string.

is_integer.description:
Determines if the amount value associated with this unit should be treated as integer.
Set to false, to measure continuous sizes likes masses or lengths.

use_si_prefix.description:
Determines if the unit can be used with SI Prefixes (kilo, giga, milli, etc.).
Useful for sizes like meters. For this the unit must be set

parent.description: Get the parent of this element.

addedDate.description: Returns the date/time when the element was created.

lastModified.description: Returns the last time when the element was modified.

id.description:
The Identification number for this part. This value is unique for the element in this table.
Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

Part-Read.description:
Part class.

The class properties are split over various traits in directory PartTraits.
Otherwise, this class would be too big, to be maintained.

parameters.description: Mapping done in subclasses.

addedDate.description: Returns the date/time when the element was created.

lastModified.description: Returns the last time when the element was modified.

id.description:
The Identification number for this part. This value is unique for the element in this table.
Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

needs_review.description: Determines if this part entry needs review (for example, because it is work in progress)

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags, associated with the part

mass.description: How much a single part unit weighs in grams

ipn.description: The internal part number of the part

providerReference.description: The reference to the info provider, that provided the information about this part

description.description: A text describing what this part does

comment.description: A comment/note related to this part

favorite.description: true, if the part is marked as favorite

category.description:
The category this part belongs too (e.g. Resistors). Use tags, for more complex grouping.
Every part must have a category.

footprint.description: The footprint of this part (e.g. DIP8)

partLots.description: A list of part lots where this part is stored

minamount.description:
The minimum amount of the part that has to be instock, otherwise more is ordered.
Given in the partUnit.

partUnit.description: the unit in which the part's amount is measured

manufacturer_product_url.description: The url to the part on the manufacturer's homepage

manufacturer_product_number.description: The product number used by the manufacturer. If this is set to "", the name field is used.

manufacturing_status.description: The production status of this part. Can be one of the specified ones.

orderdetails.description: The details about how and where you can order this part

associated_parts_as_owner.description: All associations where this part is the owner

associated_parts_as_other.description: All associations where this part is the owned/other part

total_instock.description:
Returns the summed amount of this part (over all part lots)
Part Lots that have unknown value or are expired, are not used for this value (counted as 0).

projectBuildPart.description: Checks whether this part represents the builds of a project

Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

PartAssociation-Write.description:
This entity describes a part association, which is a semantic connection between two parts.
For example, a part association can be used to describe that a part is a replacement for another part.

type.description: The type of this association (how the two parts are related)

other_type.description:
A user definable association type, which can be described in the comment field, which
is used if the type is OTHER

comment.description: A comment describing this association further.

owner.description: The part which "owns" this association, e.g. the part which is a replacement for another part

other.description: The part which is "owned" by this association, e.g. the part which is replaced by another part

git_commit.description: The Git branch commit of the Part-DB version (or null, if not installed via git)

banner.description: The banner, shown on homepage (markdown encoded)

description.description: A short description about this lot, shown in table

comment.description: a comment stored with this lot

expiration_date.description:
Set a time until when the lot must be used.
Set to null, if the lot can be used indefinitely.

instock_unknown.description: If this is set to true, the instock amount is marked as not known

amount.description: The amount of parts in this lot. For integer-quantities this value is rounded to the next integer.

needs_refill.description: determines if this lot was manually marked for refilling

owner.description: The owner of this part lot

user_barcode.description: The content of the barcode of this part lot (e.g. a barcode on the package put by the vendor)

id.description:
The Identification number for this part. This value is unique for the element in this table.
Null if the element is not saved to DB yet.

StorageLocation-Write.description: This entity represents a storage location, where parts can be stored.

StorageLocation.jsonapi.description: This entity represents a storage location, where parts can be stored.

comment.description: Get the comment of the element as markdown encoded string.

is_full.description: When this attribute is set, it is not possible to add additional parts or increase the instock of existing parts.

only_single_part.description: When this property is set, only one part (but many instock) is allowed to be stored in this store location.

limit_to_existing_parts.description: When this property is set, it is only possible to increase the instock of parts, that are already stored here.

part_owner_must_match.description: If this is set to true, only parts lots, which are owned by the same user as the store location are allowed to be stored here.

addedDate.description: Returns the date/time when the element was created.

lastModified.description: Returns the last time when the element was modified.

User.jsonapi.description:
This entity represents a user, which can log in and have permissions.
Also, this entity is able to save some information about the user, like the names, email-address and other info.

_id.description:
Get the ID. The ID can be zero, or even negative (for virtual elements). If an element is virtual, can be
checked with isVirtualElement().

lastModified.description: Returns the last time when the element was modified.

addedDate.description: Returns the date/time when the element was created.

disabled.description: Determines if the user is disabled (user can not log in)

pw_reset_token.description: the hash of a token the user must provide when he wants to reset his password

aboutMe.description: A self-description of the user as markdown text

backupCodes.description: A list of backup codes that can be used, if the user has no access to its Google Authenticator device

group.description:
the group this user belongs to
DO NOT PUT A fetch eager here! Otherwise, you can not unset the group of a user! This seems to be some kind of bug in doctrine. Maybe this is fixed in future versions.

googleAuthenticatorSecret.description: The secret used for Google authenticator

email.description: The email address of the user

show_email_on_profile.description: True if the user wants to show his email address on his (public) profile

department.description: The department the user is working

last_name.description: The last name of the User

first_name.description: The first name of the User

need_pw_change.description: True if the user needs to change password after log in

name.description: Get the name of this element.

backupCodesGenerationDate.description: The time when the backup codes were generated

currency.description:
The currency the user wants to see prices in.
Dont use fetch=EAGER here, this will cause problems with setting the currency setting.
TODO: This is most likely a bug in doctrine/symfony related to the UniqueEntity constraint (it makes a db call).
TODO: Find a way to use fetch EAGER (this improves performance a bit)

pw_reset_expires.description: the time until the password reset token is valid

saml_user.description: True if the user was created by a SAML provider (and therefore cannot change its password)

anonymousUser.description: Checks if the current user, is the user which represents the not logged in (anonymous) users.

username.description: A visual identifier that represents this user.

fullName.description: Returns the full name in the format FIRSTNAME LASTNAME [(USERNAME)].

googleAuthenticatorEnabled.description: Return true if the user should do two-factor authentication.

googleAuthenticatorUsername.description: Return the username that should be shown in Google Authenticator.

trustedTokenVersion.description: Return version for the trusted device token. Increase version to invalidate all trusted token of the user.

iD.description:
Get the ID. The ID can be zero, or even negative (for virtual elements). If an element is virtual, can be
checked with isVirtualElement().
